item.description:
Updating

String finished. 10.07.2019 Reference: 数据结构与算法/leetcode/lintcode题解 Java StringBuffer 和 StringBuilder 类 String vs StringBuffer vs StringBuilder

String

Create

”‘java String s1 = new String(); String s2 = “kezhao”; “’

Get Length

”‘java int s2Len = s2.length(); “’

Substring

”‘java s2.substring(2, 6); // return “zhao” “’ Start from 2, end before 6.

StringBuilder and StringBuffer

We need StringBuilder(or StringBuffer) when modify the original String. We know string is immutable in Java, which means when we do String manipulation, it generates a new String and discards the older one for garbage collection. In single-thread environment or we don’t care about thread safety, use StringBuilder. In other cases, use StringBuffer. “‘java StringBuilder s3 = new StringBuilder(s2.substring(2, 6)); “’

Append

”‘java s3.append(“ke”); “’

StringBuilder to String

”‘java String s2New = s3.toString(); // return “zhaoke” “’

String to Char Array

”‘java char[] s2Char = s2.toCharArray(); “’

Char at Index

”‘java char ch = s2.charAt(4); // return ‘a’ “’

Find the first char in String

int index = s2.indexOf(‘e’); // return 1. if not found, return -1
